article: Year after year my brothers, sister and I would lie in bed awake on Christmas morning. We were just _ to hear my father's voice saying it was all right to come down . Usually I was the first one jumped out of bed. I can still _ my growing eagerness for the _ every year. Even now as I look through the boxes of Christmas decorations I can see the familiar ones: the presents with our birth years on them, our five stockings, four for the _ , one for the dog. It used to be easy for us to _ when to put up the decorations. But now since we all have _ and social lives, it is usually a hurried activity. As we get older, the season almost brings a _ to a little place in our hearts. The worst was year after my grandparents had _ . We couldn't go to their house to celebrate the holiday anymore. _ , we just had a get-together in my house. Now when I think back to it, I miss the special _ my grandfather gave me for Christmas. I even miss him _ me "Jessie", even though I can't _ when people call me that. Things change, not always for the good, _ not always for the bad either. And the things that don't _ have the most important meaning to us, and I am sure they will be there for the _ of our lives. After all, every time I hear my father's _ "All right you guys, come on down, nice and slow" and we go down the stairs, first my brother, then me, then my sister, then my older brother, I still _ the true Christmas spirit.
